intro: Calycera monocephala, commonly known as the single-headed calycera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a single, compact head, making it distinctive among its relatives. The leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs.
